div.p: 1. The dominant general word for everything written is shū 書. (However, note that the word also refers specifically to a letter.)
2. Zhì 志 typically refers to a systematic coherent record.
3. Jì 記 refers to an ordered record designed to serve as an aide-memoire.
4. Jí 籍 refers to a formal and official record, typically a population register or a written official statute.
5. Zhuàn 傳 refers to an explanatory record, typically a record based on or commenting upon other written sources.
6. Lǎn 覽 refers to a comprehensive survey on a subject.
7. Xí 檄 refers to a written military command.
8. Sān chǐ 三尺 refers to the text of a law formally inscribed on large three-foot tablets.
9. Cè 冊／策 refers to a document, typically in the form of a bundle of bamboo strips.
簿，賬目和文書記事本； “ 帳 ” 出現後， “ 簿 ” 專表文書記事本。
rough draft to BEGIN TO identify synonym group members for analysis, based on CL etc. 18.11.2003. CH ／

bibl.title: A Dictionary of Selected Synonyms in the Principal Indo-European Languages

note.p: F collects many Han reliefs depicting books.

Anthologia sive Florilegium rerum et materiarum selectarum
古漢語常用詞同義詞詞典

sense.def: inscribed ancestral tablet placed in temple GULIANG 作喜公主"made an ancestral tablet for Lord Xi"

entry.def: Zhuàn 傳 refers to an explanatory record, typically a record based on or commenting upon other written sources.

sense.def: traditional account based on pre-existing sources, tradition

entry.def: Cè 冊／策 refers to a document, typically in the form of a bundle of bamboo strips.
Cè 冊／策 refers to a document, typically in the form of a bundle of bamboo strips.
Cè 冊／策 refers to a document, typically in the form of a bundle of bamboo strips.

sense.def: bundle of bamboo strips for writing on; document; recordsbamboo or wooden strips woven together as a mat (the character 冊 depicts this). Ordinarily hemp was used for string, but silk could be used for especially valuable writings; perhaps leather ( 韋 ) was used in a similar way. On each strip were cut triangular indentations to keep the string in place. It was common to have two or three strings ( 編, 道 ). The last strip served as a center around which the 冊 was wrapped. On the back of the first strip the title of the 冊 could be written. Each strip could have a serial number. 冊 and 策 appear to be used interchangably, except that wheras 策 is a general word for strips of any length women in the above way, 策 (cf. its original meaning of "whip") is preferably made of rather long strips. 冊 is not used for counting written material. [JP]STATIONARY
using a formal document, certified by a document > legally > formally, officially

entry.def: Zhì 志 typically refers to a systematic coherent record.2
The dominant general word for everything written is shū 書. (However, note that the word also refers specifically to a letter.)

sense.def: literary document; writings; written document of any kind; often specifically: official document; book; stationary

entry.def: Xí 檄 refers to a written military command.

sense.def: a long (2 chǐ 尺) jiǎn 簡, typically used for writing military commands on
wooden tablet inscribed with duties at court; ritual 笏 were made of jade

entry.def: Jǐ2 籍 refers to a formal and official record, typically a population register or a written official statute.

sense.def: documents of state; written non-legal records of state
documents of state, statutes of state
N have been registered; a list of Ns have been made
BUDDH: basket/repository > set of canonical Buddhist texts, see 三臧

entry.def: Lǎn 覽 refers to a comprehensive survey on a subject.
Jì 記 refers to an ordered record designed to serve as an aide-memoire.

sense.def: (that which is recorded>) a record; ordered record to aid memory; a written notice

entry.def: Sān chǐ 三尺 refers to the text of a law formally inscribed on large three-foot tablets.

sense.def: long wooden tablet used for writing down laws
Annals; often specifically: the Annals attributed to Confucius
BUDDH: skr. dharma-piṭaka (collection of Buddhist texts; see san1zàng 三藏)
mystical prophetical books of the Eastern Han
BUDDH: skr. vinaya-piṭaka (collection of monastic rules and related texts)
BUDDH: skr. Sūtra-piṭaka (collection of the sermons of Buddha)
BUDDH: skr. Abidharma-piṭaka (collection of texts consisting of commentaries on the sūtras)
formal document stating results of an agreement or a public order etc.
a chapter of the Book of Documents, whose standard name is Lü3xing2 呂刑
"Great Elegantiae", one of the major parts of the Book of Songs
"Great Elegantiae", one of the major parts of the Book of Songs
maps and tax registers; the key documents of a state
chapters and sections, components of a book
also written as 獄辭: written confession
